meanings.definition: To remove or erase by rubbing.
meanings.sent1: She tried to ruboff the pencil marks from the paper.
meanings.sent2: I need to ruboff the stain on my shirt before it sets.
meanings.sent3: After a messy art project, she had to ruboff the paint splatters from the table.
meanings.sent4: The eraser can ruboff mistakes easily on the paper.
meanings.sent5: The sandpaper can ruboff the rough edges of the wood smoothly.

meanings.definition: A transfer of ink or color from one surface to another.
meanings.sent1: The ruboff from the magazine left a mark on the table.
meanings.sent2: He accidentally created a ruboff of the painting on the canvas below.
meanings.sent3: The ruboff of the ink on his hands made it look like he had been painting.
meanings.sent4: The ruboff of the dye from the fabric stained the white shirt.
meanings.sent5: The ruboff of the marker on the whiteboard was difficult to clean.

meanings.definition: A person who learns or imitates by observing or interacting with others.
meanings.sent1: She is a ruboff who always mirrors the behavior of her friends.
meanings.sent2: He is a ruboff, picking up new skills by watching others.
meanings.sent3: The little girl was a ruboff, copying her sister's every move.
meanings.sent4: Being a ruboff, he quickly adapted to the new environment.
meanings.sent5: The ruboff in the group helped everyone learn from each other.
